title: Duties of guardian
context: ยง560:5-314 Duties of guardian. (a) Except as otherwise limited by the court, a guardian shall make decisions regarding the ward&rsquo;s support, care, education, health, and welfare. A guardian shall exercise authority only as necessitated by the ward&rsquo;s limitations and, to the extent possible, shall encourage the ward to participate in decisions, act on the ward&rsquo;s own behalf, and develop or regain the capacity to manage the ward&rsquo;s personal affairs. A guardian, in making decisions, shall consider the expressed desires and personal values of the ward to the extent known to the guardian. A guardian at all times shall act in the ward&rsquo;s best interest and exercise reasonable care, diligence, and prudence. (b) A guardian shall: (1) Become or remain personally acquainted with the ward and maintain sufficient contact with the ward to know of the ward&rsquo;s capacities, limitations, needs, opportunities, and physical and mental health; (2) Take reasonable care of the ward&rsquo;s personal effects and bring protective proceedings if necessary to protect the property of the ward; (3) Expend money of the ward that has been received by the guardian, for the ward&rsquo;s current needs for support, care, education, health, and welfare; (4) Conserve any excess money of the ward for the ward&rsquo;s future needs; provided that if a conservator has been appointed for the estate of the ward, the guardian shall pay the money to the conservator, at least quarterly, to be conserved for the ward&rsquo;s future needs; (5) Immediately notify the court if the ward&rsquo;s condition has changed so that the ward is capable of exercising rights previously removed; and (6) Inform the court of any change in the ward&rsquo;s custodial dwelling or address. [L 2004, c 161, pt of ยง1]
